website_summaries.verdict: Tripod’s ball head smoothly swivels and tilts in any direction to simplify shooting odd-angle photos.
pros: Folds down to a small size of 14.5 inches in length, which means the photographer can carry it anywhere easily
Only weighs 2.6 pounds, which is perfect for hiking
Has four leg sections, allowing the photographer to adjust the height of the camera to fit any situation.Tripod remains stable, even when fully extended to 55 inches
cons: Tripod consists of aluminum, so it’s not able to stand up to rough conditions as well as a carbon fiber unit

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a nice and solid Tripp’s for my Sony a6000 that has a peak design capture clip attached. I didn’t want it removed for efficiency and took the gamble by getting this bonfoto Tripod and I’m super glad it did.fits the peak standard capture clip so it should fit arcs Swiss plates. The knob expands so it doesn’t matter how wide. Slides in and out and locks it in securely. Can’t wait to take it out! Built well and love the red accents to match the peak design accessories I have. Fits the peak design sling also!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ly

customer_reviews.title: Steady as a rock!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Got my Eclipse photo using this baby - steady as a rock. Robert E Clark, Santa Monica, CA., 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Where to begin! I bought this for my girlfriend, who is in to photography and is trying to step up her equipment game. Looks like after fooling around with it, I’ll be getting one myself! My $350 Mefoto tripod is extremely comparable to the quality of this guy! In fact, this tripod even holds more weight! Unbelievable deal, and I’ll come back to this review to see how it tests in the field!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny F

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made and glad I got it. There is a hard to remove dead zone or play area in the center which makes steady shots hardr
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. The loss in stars is due to the gimbal having play in the center. I mean loose in dead center no matter what I do. Everything else on the TP is made very well. The ball on which the camera sits and has near 360 degree movement with has a loose spot or "play" in the center which makes it extremely hard to get the really long shots I am taking. There is no sweet spot between too much and too little for the dial to be effective. Otherwise, it is a good TP for the price. Well made...except that part. It is plastic for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Slik

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and clunky, looks cheap and is.
customer_reviews.text: While I've heard mixed opinions about "cheap" carbon fiber tripods, it's really up to the customer to hold and examine a tripod before deciding that it may meet their needs. I found the Bonfoto carbon fiber tripod to be markedly larger and bulkier than comparable tripods. It just had a "cheap" feel about it. Bonfoto is an unfamiliar brand in the U.S., at least with no online reviews. I emailed the company to ask a few questions but received no response. I returned the two tripods.
customer_reviews.author: David Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Well made compact tripod for price paid
customer_reviews.text: Just received this tripod and have not used yet but it appears well made. I purchased for travel because of it's 14.5 min height. Also really like the ballhead and use of knobs instead of levers/handles that were constantly in the way and hard to pack. Now I just need to find an additional quick release plate to have as a backup and to use on my backup camera for convenience. Update: Based on answer provided by another purchaser I purchased on Amazon Harwerrel 50mm Quick Release Plate Fits Arca-Swiss Standard for Camera Tripod Ballhead (Pack of 2) and they work great and are cheaper than the brand suggested by the seller
customer_reviews.author: brown

customer_reviews.title: Only thing better than the tripod is the service!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional photographer and I have just started fooling around with nature and landscapes. I was looking for a lightweight, sturdy, well-designed tripod that I could hike with all day long. This item fills the bill. It feels well made and allowed me to take all kinds of shots. I feel confident putting my camera on this tripod. All of the controls feel smooth and secure. It looks like a much more expensive tripod. I experienced a minor issue with the ball head and Bonfoto resolved my issue, no questions asked, within 1 business day! I will definitely be buying again from Bonfoto.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tripod with only one minor improvement suggestion...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Very compact and light which is a great benefit for a travel tripod and the fact it converts to a monopod is fantastic! One very minor niggle is that they should incorporate a pocket in the carrying case for the small extension piece so that it doesn’t end up scratching the tripod legs when traveling enroute to your destination with it inside the bag. Yeah it might cost a bit more to sew that in during manufacturing but I’d be willing to pay that extra so that I don’t mess up the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. S.

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, quality item at good price
customer_reviews.text: I held off buying a new tripod for several years. I did not think a tripod like this one would enhance that much. I was happy to find I was wrong, and wish I would have gotten this sooner. I am very pleased with this tripod, and the versatility. Most of all, the construction and quality was excellent. I used this at times to mount a 300mm lens & DSLR without any problems at all. I would recommend this item, and for the price I paid I felt it was an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but not "ultralight"!
customer_reviews.text: I like the tripod. Very sturdy for my mirror-less DSLR. I was hoping for a lighter weight unit, but this is OK. It's not as compact as I thought it would be. I'm an ultralight backpacker/photographer. This model is not as compact as I would like, but I did like the price. I'll be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: sheelister

customer_reviews.title: Sticky tripod head?
customer_reviews.text: I love this professional tripod, but my biggest problem is the fact that the head's rubber portions got all sticky and got all over me, what's the deal with that? Otherwise it's great! UPDATE: Excellent customer service, after several VERY kind emails back and forth my problem has been solved and the team offered several options including a replacement for the portion I was having trouble with. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality of this carbon-fiber tripod, especially on an Amazon Lightning Deal. Reasonably sturdy, not too heave, folds into easily carried bundle. However, the instruction "manual" leaves a lot to be desired — it's a single half-page written in Chinese, poorly translated into English (e.g., "Can be put head."), and does not explain what one of the included parts is or how to use it (i figured out that it's a 4" extension for the center pole). Importer could do better in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Moves a little after being srt.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was me doing something wrong or not getting it tight enough when I locked it in place. I kept on setting up and there is a noticeable drop in my camera's sight picture when I release the camera. I learned to compensate for it fairly quickly and have not had any issues with since. All things considered I feel it is a fairly well made tripod for the price and I have no fears of it collapsing with my camera attached.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Ive have always bought cheap tripods in the past and none of them have been any good. So this time I decided to spend a little more. This one caught my eye because of the red trim. When I got it, i was very surprised on how easy it was to use. It is very portable for its size, that is a big thing I am happy about. It is also lightweight, so it can be taken with you anywhere, even in a purse or small backpack. A very important thing for a tripod as well, it is very sturdy and the controls are easy to adjust to take a good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Ball Head and Quick Camera connect slip
customer_reviews.text: The tripod seems to be good quality overall, but the ball head slips with my Canon 5D Mark II and the 20-70MM Lens on it. I tightened it is tight as possible and it still slips. The quick Camera plate also slips and the camera rotates. The quick connect should have a thin piece of rubber on it to prevent it from rotating so much. I bought the camera to take on vacation to Bahamas to take family pics on the beach. I liked the overall small size and weight for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Brun

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lightweight tripod but is super sturdy and really easy to use. I haven't had a lot of experience with tripod work, but needed it for a class. I didn't want to spend $200 at the camera store so after looking around and researching, chose this. It was fantastic! Easy to carry. Easy to fold up and store. Easy to extend the legs. Easy to mount and dismount camera body when I needed to. I wasn't expecting it to be excellent quality for the money, but it is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the bad reviews - this one is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of ordering a cheap tripod that broke after using it twice - no joke. This one is AWESOME! I LOVE the color scheme - black with red looks really cool. Has lots of quality feeling metal and places that allow adjustments. I'm very happy with my choice to buy this one even though it had some bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tripod that is Compact and seems Well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tripod that is compact and seems well designed. It is easy to setup and seems stable enough. It is very reasonably priced for compact tripods and can substitute for the very expensive models that may have a few more bells and whistles. It's small enough to fit in a travel suitcase but like all well made tripods does add some weight. It is not sturdy enough for a pro but for the rest of us that take an occasional trip, this is a perfect tripod to include if you have the room in your suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Roger JamesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight and versatile this tripod is. How steady it holds my camera and feels sturdy when mounted. Holds my camera nice and snug. The finish on the gloss on the tripod is super appealing too. Like the way I can easily make it into a monopod and run. I got a 360 degree turn at a twist of a knob which is great so I don’t have to move the whole tripod around. Tested this out in the open at a park and for the price I’m pleased with how it turned out. Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mingze xu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic 'backcountry' tripod. super sturdy, love the way it folds up - I've had my 7D Mk II with a 70-200mm telephoto on it + accessories (most of 10 LBS) - no issues. being so compact, i wish it was a bit taller - but for the price you cant do any better
customer_reviews.author: Neal. I

customer_reviews.title: It does the job for me
customer_reviews.text: I use a 'pro' tripod for my work and I needed a compact that would fit in my luggage for a recent trip. This one did the trick and went with me in my suitcase. It is sturdy and stable enough to securely hold my camera. The only negative comment that I can make is how long it takes to set up when I need it (still just a few minutes). I recommend the Bonfoto if you need a compact tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and robust Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I sold a bunch of my camera equipment but needed another tripod for mounting some radio equipment and this fit the bill. I was looking for a strong, and robust tripod to support some antennas which wouldn't just fall over in the wind. This tripod seems to have a handy case, solid base, an aluminum ratcheting mechanism, and well designed adjustments for the head. Overall, I am super pleased with this tripod and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews and Suggestions

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met and surpassed
customer_reviews.text: This was my first professional grade tripod, it does a good job. It holds the camera steady and adjusts like I want it to. The built in monopod feature is great for walking to get wildlife photos. The only issue I’ve had is the metal collar that holds the center column in place got lose when converting it to the monopod. It was caused by me rushing and over loosening the collar, it went back in place though. The hook under the middle is useful for holding my camera bag when I’m setup for photos that take longer. Overall amazing performance of a tripod of this price.
customer_reviews.author: Karlie

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for travel or casual use
customer_reviews.text: First, I am 5'8" and fully extended, I need to bend down to take photos. This is a good tripod if your subject is further away, but if you want to do portrait work and your subject is within 20 feet, it gets tricky. It depends on the lens and the distance from the subject. Using an 18-105 kit lens on an APS-c camera required me to use a table to get an eye level shot, otherwise, I had to point the camera slightly upwards which can change the composition. However, if you just want to take pictures and need a decent tripod and not too concerned about bending down, if over 5'8" inches tall, this tripod is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Ayon

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty tripod
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty tripod ,but lightweight to carry in pack. I use it with my pochade box for plein air painting. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Judi P.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been messing around with the tripod for a few weeks now. I first used it in Mexico for family portraits and landscape shots on the beach. I liked that I can balance it well. The legs are sturdy and hold up well. I used it for my Nikon d750 and a zoom lens which are pretty heavy combined. It does well with the weight of the camera. The head is also sturdy and well built. Cons: I wish it stood taller so it can get to eye level for average height people.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan V.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality nice looking tripod
customer_reviews.text: Good quality nice looking tripod, especially for the price. Three stars because the tilt head is a little knob you grip with fingers while loosening the lock with the other hand, very difficult to make adjustments, would be so much better if it had a 6 or 8 inch long arm to grip and maneuver for adjustments (my other tripods have such and are much easier to fine tune).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a week on a Canon Rebel DSLR in Yellowstone and carried it around everywhere. Hiked up avalanche peak with it no problem. Fit perfectly in my carryon bag as well. The adjustments of the legs wored great where there were high winds, I swung them out to give the legs a larger footprint and had no issues with the camera tipping in 40mph winds.
customer_reviews.author: bluesdad

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and well made
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied w/ the light weight tripod, able to hike for 3 hrs and did feel the weight of this tripod. Well made and stable enough for the purpose of carrying it the whole day. This will be my travel tripod Update after 15 hrs hikes in 3 weekend the tripod well made did not feel the weight of the tripod. Very compact easy to attach the side of my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Raffy

customer_reviews.title: Great portability and construction!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to carry it around Italy with me and I was thrilled with the portability and the design. It is light weight enough to strap to my camera backpack, small enough to not stick out over the top of my bag so it was never in the way and versatile enough for every situation that I encountered. The only issue that I had with it was that the grease under the plate where the head rotates came out and got all over my hands and was incredibly sticky which ended up on my camera. Overall, I would completely recommend this tripod to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wolslegel

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy tripod, portable and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on clients and also when I travel. It is super sturdy, yet super portable and not heavy at all! The build quality is great and I love the fact it can be a monopod also! I use this with both my A7III and A6400!
customer_reviews.author: KM.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tripod for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod for the price. Not a big fan of the camera plate but hay for this price you can't really complain about it. A little flimsy when the legs are fully extended but that's expected for the compact size and light waight. Overall, very happy with this travel tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Clint13

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This tripod suits my every need. It feels sturdy, the ball head is smooth and tightens down well, and it's very lightweight. I purchased a much pricier tripod in the $200 range and had buyers remorse; after returning it and switching to this one I can honestly say the only difference is the price and Bonfoto's far superior color scheme. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little tripod. No problem supporting my 5D3 and 100 /400 mm lens. Perfect size for travel.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Light Compact Tripod
customer_reviews.text: It has a bag hook which adds stability and keeps your bag off the floor. It's also more than sturdy enough to hold a pro level body with a heavy lens. It quickly changes to underslung mode which allows you to easily get into some awkward angle, this would be very useful for macro and you can get your tripod right down to ground level. It also becomes a monopod by removing one of the legs and screwing it into the tripod head. Very useful indeed. Great value for money, I can't imagine many tripods in the same price range coming close.
customer_reviews.author: Marylou W.

customer_reviews.title: Feels and looks good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for one day but it appears to be very high quality for the price. Everything works smoothly and as expected. I love the versatility to give low angle shots. Handles my Nikon D7100 with 18-400 telephoto lens. Look forward to using it on upcoming trip through northwest states and parks.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Very  nice !!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely give it a 5 star review! Its very sturdy, but I'm just hoping the height will be good for my shoots. I thought I purchased the 65 inch but accidentally put this one in my cart. Oh well, it's a great tripod either way.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Devil

customer_reviews.title: It was sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got this for our vacation to Glacier National Park in Montana and it was exactly what we needed/were looking for. It was sturdy and easy to use. Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Tolley

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, light duty, designed well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light weight tripod to shoot some pics with my Nikon D6, using a small lens for time lapse. I have a couple of Manfrotto big ones I normally use, but get tired of lugging them around. The Bonfotto Tripod works great for light duty applications, and overall I was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. As long as you don’t bang it around a lot. We take it into the wilderness and use it quite harshly and it’s still kicking after using it every weekend for the past 2 years in the wind rain and snow. IDE recommend you a friend
customer_reviews.author: Who's your dady

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor photography
customer_reviews.text: Used it for outdoor photography and its helpful. It also can be broken down into a single stand which is another benefit of the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Shashin

customer_reviews.title: Lighter and obviously much cheaper than the Peak Design tripod
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tripod at this price point. Professional feel. I was looking for the lightest stable tripod I could find and I'm glad I gave this a shot and didn't fall for the hype of more expensive legs.
customer_reviews.author: someguy

customer_reviews.title: Creative features
customer_reviews.text: Really lightweight, very convenient to adjust, the top pole can be detached and used upside down, really convenient for macro photography , it also has an angle measure, which is very convenient for time lapse shooting of the milky way
customer_reviews.author: adi

customer_reviews.title: Solid, light weight, well made
customer_reviews.text: A simple light weight and well made tripod. It packs into a very small bag. Portable and the release clasps tight and release easily. The product appears to be bullet proof. Easy to use, solid, excellent machining. Five stars...
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I think this is among the best ball mount cap tripods at an excellent cost for quality factor.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tripod over many others because of the many good reviews, the obvious superior construction and the cost vs quality factor. This is a ball cap mount type....i bought a different tripod with the swing hing cap mount. So now i have a good representative of each type. Suits me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tripod for d3400
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good value. my d3400 mounts to this very well and it's easy to control. The level on the top is a nice feature to have. The legs seem strong and It is light and fits in its bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: B&k

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for city walking and hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Best tripod that I had, and that I will take with me in my daily city walks, and hiking. Added a carabiner to the bag, Can carry it with me all day long. I use an A7 with kit and other light lenses, it does what is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: John Pell

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel tripod I have found. Most of them are too flexible when extended and are not completely stable. This carbon fiber tripod is stiff when extended and remarkably small when collapsed, as well as light in weight. All parts are high quality and everything is thoughtfully designed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this tripod I purchased a few others but they ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod I purchased a few others but they did not work for the application that I needed. I have a guerilla watercolor board and wanted the freedom to be able to turn it in any direction and this one works amazing. i did a lot of reseach and the one that shows for the guerilla is for water color box. the locking mechanism on this model locks it in place securely and works amazing..
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl A`Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Nikon camera and I love it. It is truly lightweight and very portable. I like how it folds up in different sections, making it easy to transport. When I need to use it, it takes less than a minute to unfold and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia E Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for an artist.
customer_reviews.text: I am a plein air artist and I've incorporated my Bonfoto tripod with a Sienna pochade box. It is heavy duty enough to handle the box, palette and canvases. The hidden bonus is that it is very light weight and folds down as small as any I've seen. I have a lot of envious friends.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Polk

customer_reviews.title: pretty light - does the job for night-still & landscape ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this on vacation to Rome & Amalfi, neat, small, strong enough, pretty light - does the job for night-still & landscape shots, also the zip-up travel bag with shoulder strap is well-made, perfect for city walking / hiking etc; no hesitation to recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great carbon fiber budget Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very nice high quality tripod I used to have one that I had to hold because of the wind but this one does not move and it’s very solid. The only thing is that it’s a little heavier than I expected but overall I’m happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Solid well made product
customer_reviews.text: Well made lightweight product. All the parts fit and moved well. Used it twice. Instructions could have been better - i am a novice.
customer_reviews.author: toyocoro

customer_reviews.title: It is a great tripod! I was researching them and found this ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It is a great tripod! I was researching them and found this one to be the best one for my budget. I couldn't spend much and needed a great tripod. I am glad I chose this one. I had a Bonfoto and I chose to drop it so I had to get another one. I like this one even better than my last one.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur plus photographer and so I want good quality but do not want to fork out a lot of cash for equipment. This met my needs perfectly. Good design, sturdy, and all for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: jke

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal
customer_reviews.text: I required a backpack-sized tripod that would function in extreme cold. This worked out well, especially for the price. There was a problem with a missing component, but the vendor moved heaven and earth to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E. Dorfman

customer_reviews.title: Pro Tripod and Easy to set up Carry and use everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I used this tripod last weekend. It is easy to set it up outside dor professional shooting. Tripod is very light to carry. Easy to connect your machine. You can turm 360 degree and locked which way you like it. 3 different lock position on leg side and 2 different setting on neck side. You can use professional purpose or personal. I am usinf both ways totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: derya kockansoy

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is a light weight, but it's not safe when you need to change your angle to shoot. It spins and drops around without stability. I have to hold my camera every single time to make sure it doesn't fall off. It looks and works great, but not perfect. Makes me a little nervous using my expensive sony camera and lens. The height is great and it comes with a travel bag and tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod for its light weight and price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design. Will use it in the field next month on VaCa. Love how small it folds down too. Looking forward to testing the plate base adjustment mechanism. Looks like it will be a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jkkiller11

customer_reviews.title: So far I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: Great support for my canon g7x . Love the weight hook for added support. Very sturdy. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So close....
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility but the quick release mechanism does not hold a camera tightly, so it has a little wiggle to it which defeats the whole purpose of the tripod. Tried to reach out for help but Amazon had no way to contact anyone that could help. So close to great, but basically useless. If they reach out with help I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Best Tripod ever! So easy to use, much better than my older tripod. I like this so much I will be buying another one. When compared to the other brands, the price seemed reasonable and the quality is extremely high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have to read the description better it doesn't go as high as I would've liked thanks
customer_reviews.author: Bob Maywhort

customer_reviews.title: Nice casual travel tripod for this serious amateur
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a vacation in Sedona. Worked well with my Canon 5D and medium weight lenses. Folds up nicely, fits well in my carry on bag, and isn't really heavy. Good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: SteveG

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, lightweight and quality construction!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tripod! It is heavy duty, but light, and it can hold my camera steady in all kinds of awkward places that a traditional tripod could not do. It is of excellent quality and it came when expected.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Houman

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tripod - recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Excellet tripod very light and compact and strong enough for my largest camera and lens. Fast delivery and very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my carry on!
customer_reviews.text: This fits in my carry on AND in my backpack. Awesome for travel. Feels super durable. So far I love it!
customer_reviews.author: mildogger

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod at a great price! I knew I wanted one with a ball head for easier rotation. Not only is this tripod light it's so easy to use. I love the design and color. It also has a level which comes in really handy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Both looks and feels great!  Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: So far have only used this in m home, but t is very well made, feels great, looks and feels solid. The only downside is that it’s very compact, so there are several extensions on each leg (to make it fold up shorter). But that’s not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: took on long trip.
customer_reviews.text: This really worked well on the trip. Sturdy and very easy to use in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN B. MOORE

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal value
customer_reviews.text: I found this tripod to have very high build quality, better than I would expect for the price. I don't have any experience with high end tripods, however this one is significantly better than cheap ones you'd find at department stores at a similar price point.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Llerena

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod, not so great bag.
customer_reviews.text: The tripod is great, but I would've really liked a tripod bag that zips. As soon as I opened the box upon delivery I noticed the zipper on the bag was broken. I tried fixing it for the past week but I finally gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for low cost, fully adjustable tri-pods to use for flash stands during nocturnal wildlife photography and these fit the bill perfectly. I started with 3 of them and now have five.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Wings Ecology, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality tripod. I didn't reconized the brand, but am very impressed with the form, fit, and finish. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Haver

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy little tripod. Seems to be well made. Everything functions well on it like it’s supposed to. Easy to pack along. Sets up and takes down quickly. Smooth fluid motion in the ball head allows nice panning video and great panorama shots. So far I’m very happy with this tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy with money

customer_reviews.title: Good tripod.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light and yet sturdy tripod. Excellent for traveling as it will fit even in your carry on bag. Very stable for being a small tripod.
customer_reviews.author: JLEMUS

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the money, but head is only average.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of the easy lock levers on the legs, and don’t like the screw type. My only complaint would be the head, which I replaced with the BH-100, making this quite road worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T.

customer_reviews.title: phone holder not included
customer_reviews.text: The tripod is solid but the ad said phone holder included but didn't came with it other than that solid...
customer_reviews.author: envoy13

customer_reviews.title: An excellent, well built tripod.
customer_reviews.text: All in all, an excellent tripod. Lightweight and well built, and all of the controls and knobs work smoothly. Even its well padded carry bag comes with premium YKK zippers. I would definitely purchase another Bonfoto tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrus

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was compact when collapsed making it handy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: maureen from Long Island

customer_reviews.title: very strong
customer_reviews.text: i usually dont leave review but . the item i received is best i have gt so far. it is made out of good material. it is tall enough to use for every purpose. i am using this for my business and out door. i will recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Bishal verma

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality construction. Feels solid as a rock ...
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality construction. Feels solid as a rock. I will update in a few months if it falls apart, as this has been a theme with other tripods by other manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Dog

customer_reviews.title: ... tripod from the 80's and this one is very nice! Love the quick release so I can take ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old tripod from the 80's and this one is very nice! Love the quick release so I can take my camera off quickly and it doesn't cover my battery/memory card door. Folds up smaller and has a carrying bag, great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Klynstra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tripod
customer_reviews.text: I can use this tripod anywhere. Its solid, not too light, but not too heavy. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Solid little tripod, holds camera and zoom lens with no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly holds my Canon rebel t6i with a 18-135mm zoom lens (had been worried about needing a longer plate for the zoom lens but no issues!) Easy to adjust and use, seems very durable and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Small size
customer_reviews.text: I like this product for many different reasons, but the main one is the size it folds down to 14.5” which for me is ideal! The small size allows me to put it inside of a daypack which is very convenient yet it has the features of most standard tripods!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tripod. I've used it for a few hours now to hold three to five pounds of equipment - it seems sturdy and has worked great. The ball head has also worked well holding my one pound camera.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: So far I am enjoying using my new tripod. ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I am enjoying using my new tripod. Bought it to help me with taking macro shot. Since I am constantly adjusting the legs, I am hoping the locks work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Pekelo

customer_reviews.title: Steady as it goes
customer_reviews.text: A bit heavier than anticipated but found the tripod easy to use overall and decently sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: NC man

customer_reviews.title: Compact but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Well made and versatile. Fits in my side pouch of camera pack and easily opens and closes. Quit pleased.
customer_reviews.author: R. Paivanas

customer_reviews.title: Quick response to report of broken item.  Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: It came broken but they replaced this right away. Very happy with this ptoduct.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Ruhlig

customer_reviews.title: Love this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tripod and I have to say, I love it!! It is well worth the money. It is sturdy and I don’t have to worry about it toppling over. The ONLY problem I have is the latch (don’t know what the proper word is🙂) that lets you extend the legs is a little hard to push. I hope this doesn’t turn into a problem down the road. But I really am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: durable, all joints and clamp are stable and smooth
customer_reviews.text: The quality is better then expected. Feels very durable, all joints and clamp are stable and smooth. I like how it can be folded to a very compact size and also come with a travel bag, it comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: WinstonW

customer_reviews.title: Super quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the fit and finish is awesome. I love how the legs snap into multiple positions and the ball head is extra smooth with very high quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: dodger

customer_reviews.title: Very good, though not tall and no handle for the ball head
customer_reviews.text: Great, and folds really small. Not real tall - as the description says - especially without the center shaft raised. Also, no handle for the ball head; it would be nice if it had one. But still a great tripod, with smooth operation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. Wish it was a litter nicer feeling and it does seem it could have been easily converted to a monopod. I'm sure a couple pieces and it would work as one..
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a future overseas trip because it is lightweight and compact. We travel with just a carry-on and I need to keep things small and light. I have used the tripod and it is much lighter than my previous heavy duty tripod. I'm sure it will be a great pleasure to take it on our adventure across Scotland and Ireland.
customer_reviews.author: meecymarcy

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Good amateur tripod. Not good for weighted cameras or 70-200 lenses. Plate is plastic and it’s impossible to get the plate super tight on your camera
customer_reviews.author: SHEILA

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no issues. Does the job I needed it for. Sturdy, well built. works perfect with my Canon 80D. I like the product. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Roark

product_meta.title: BONFOTO B690A Lightweight Aluminum Tripod Portable Travel Camera Stand with 360 Degree Ball Head and Carry Bag, Tripods for Canon Nikon Sony DSLR
feature_bullets: Professional: 360 degree horizontal swivel and 90 degree vertical platform with 3-way head allows you to take photos at any angle, which helps to ensure fast transitions between shots. The recommended max load capacity for this tripod is 17 lbs, 4 section leg, maximum Height: 55''

Main Features: This tripod is designed with double telescoping center columns, compact when folded and practical when extended, Includes carry bag and center column hook to add weight for additional stabilization.The design of the product decides that the leg will not slip out or even pull hard

Compact: Adjustable-height tripod is made of lightweight aluminum, weight just 2.6lbs (1.18kg) make it very suitable for outdoor, travel shooting. It can be folded 180 degree reversely, giving it a compact size of 14.5'', save your space and make it small enough to carry everywhere (included a portable tripod carrying bag)

Easy to operate: The quick release mounting plate with standard 1/4" screw and secure clip makes it possible to attach and detach your camera in seconds and prevents your camera from accident dropping. Suitable for most digital cameras and camcorders, makes your trip more enjoyable
Assurance: 24-hr customer service are always ready to help; for more information, please refer to the description

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars418 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
